speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: SCENE IV. The platform.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Enter HAMLET, HORATIO, and MARCELLUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The air bites shrewdly; it is very cold.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: It is a nipping and an eager air.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What hour now?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I think it lacks of twelve.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, it is struck.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Indeed? I heard it not: then it draws near the season

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Wherein the spirit held his wont to walk.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: A flourish of trumpets, and ordnance shot off, within

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: What does this mean, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The king doth wake to-night and takes his rouse,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Keeps wassail, and the swaggering up-spring reels;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And, as he drains his draughts of Rhenish down,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The kettle-drum and trumpet thus bray out

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The triumph of his pledge.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Is it a custom?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, marry, is't:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But to my mind, though I am native here

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And to the manner born, it is a custom

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: More honour'd in the breach than the observance.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This heavy-headed revel east and west

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Makes us traduced and tax'd of other nations:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They clepe us drunkards, and with swinish phrase

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Soil our addition; and indeed it takes

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: From our achievements, though perform'd at height,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The pith and marrow of our attribute.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So, oft it chances in particular men,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That for some vicious mole of nature in them,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As, in their birth--wherein they are not guilty,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Since nature cannot choose his origin--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: By the o'ergrowth of some complexion,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Oft breaking down the pales and forts of reason,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or by some habit that too much o'er-leavens

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The form of plausive manners, that these men,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Carrying, I say, the stamp of one defect,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Being nature's livery, or fortune's star,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Their virtues else--be they as pure as grace,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As infinite as man may undergo--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Shall in the general censure take corruption

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: From that particular fault: the dram of eale

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Doth all the noble substance of a doubt

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To his own scandal.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Look, my lord, it comes!

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Enter Ghost

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Angels and ministers of grace defend us!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Be thou a spirit of health or goblin damn'd,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Bring with thee airs from heaven or blasts from hell,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Be thy intents wicked or charitable,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thou comest in such a questionable shape

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I will speak to thee: I'll call thee Hamlet,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: King, father, royal Dane: O, answer me!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let me not burst in ignorance; but tell

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why thy canonized bones, hearsed in death,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Have burst their cerements; why the sepulchre,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Wherein we saw thee quietly inurn'd,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hath oped his ponderous and marble jaws,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To cast thee up again. What may this mean,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That thou, dead corse, again in complete steel

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Revisit'st thus the glimpses of the moon,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Making night hideous; and we fools of nature

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So horridly to shake our disposition

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With thoughts beyond the reaches of our souls?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Say, why is this? wherefore? what should we do?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ghost beckons HAMLET

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: It beckons you to go away with it,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: As if it some impartment did desire

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: To you alone.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Look, with what courteous action

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: It waves you to a more removed ground:

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: But do not go with it.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: No, by no means.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It will not speak; then I will follow it.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Do not, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, what should be the fear?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do not set my life in a pin's fee;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And for my soul, what can it do to that,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Being a thing immortal as itself?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It waves me forth again: I'll follow it.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: What if it tempt you toward the flood, my lord,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Or to the dreadful summit of the cliff

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: That beetles o'er his base into the sea,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And there assume some other horrible form,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Which might deprive your sovereignty of reason

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And draw you into madness? think of it:

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: The very place puts toys of desperation,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Without more motive, into every brain

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: That looks so many fathoms to the sea

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And hears it roar beneath.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It waves me still.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Go on; I'll follow thee.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: You shall not go, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hold off your hands.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Be ruled; you shall not go.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My fate cries out,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And makes each petty artery in this body

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As hardy as the Nemean lion's nerve.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Still am I call'd. Unhand me, gentlemen.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: By heaven, I'll make a ghost of him that lets me!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I say, away! Go on; I'll follow thee.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt Ghost and HAMLET

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: He waxes desperate with imagination.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Let's follow; 'tis not fit thus to obey him.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Have after. To what issue will this come?

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Something is rotten in the state of Denmark.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Heaven will direct it.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Nay, let's follow him.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Exeunt
